According to the prehistoric timeline of ancient Egypt the earliest settlements was located in Wadi-Halfa a region just below the Southern border of Egypt in Northern Sudan, along the Nile River in Lower Nubia. Prehistoric Egypt - Wikipedia  There was a Northward migration of people from Wadi-Halfa into Egypt during the prehistoric period. That is why all the major cultural technocomplexes from the Paleolithic period, Mesolithic period, Neolithic periods originated from Wadi-Halfa and extended Northwards into Egypt. That is the Khormusan culture, Halfan culture, Qadan culture and Sebelian culture.  That is also why the Badarian, Tasian, Naqada and A-Group cultures are strongly related to the Nubian Neolithic traditions. “Are ancient Egyptians racially different from modern Egyptians?” You have to define terms. The concept of “race”, as the term is used today, is scientifically discredited. So the question, strictly speaking, has no meaning. What is true is that Egyptians are more descended from the ancients peoples of North Africa than from other groups, though not exclusively. You find this pattern in most regions of the Old World, but not as much in the New World, especially North America.
